domain Module¶

class domain.BaseDomain(extent=array([ 1., 1., 1.]), cell_count=1)[source]¶

Base class for simulation domain, cartesian, 3D. Initialises domain with given extents.

Parameters:
  • extent (np.array(3,1)) – [x,y,z] numpy array with extents of simulation domain.
  • cellcount (int) – Number of cells within domain (optional).
boundary_correct(r_in_dat)[source]¶

Return a new position accounting for periodic boundaries. Would probably benefit from being in C.

Parameters:r_in_dat (np.array(3,1)) – input position
cell_array()[source]¶

Return cell array.

cell_count()[source]¶

Return cell count for domain.

cell_index_lin(C_in)[source]¶

Convert tuple index to linear index. Applies periodic boundaries first.

Parameters:c_in (int) – Input index to convert.
cell_index_lin_offset(C_in_abs)[source]¶

Convert tuple index to linear index. Applies periodic boundaries first. Returns periodic boundary offsets.

Parameters:c_in_abs (np.array(3,1)) – Input index to convert.
cell_index_tuple(c_in)[source]¶

Convert cell linear index to vector.

Parameters:c_in (int) – Input index.
extent()[source]¶

Returns list of domain extents.

get_cell_lin_index(r_in)[source]¶

Returns the linear cell index for a given input coordinate.

Parameters:r_in (np.array(3,1)) – Cartesian vector for particle position.
set_cell_array_explicit(cell_array)[source]¶

Set cell array with a vector.

Parameters:cell_array (np.array(3,1)) – new cell array.
set_cell_array_radius(rn)[source]¶

Create cell structure based on current extent and extended cutoff distance.

Parameters:rn (double) – rn=rc+δ

Set domain extents

Parameters:new_extent (np.array(3,1)) – New extents.
